Example for the sake of showing the table style instructions only. Discussion of the project itself is off-topic.
https://horizenofficial.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ZEN/pages/136872094/Part+3+-+Package+Installation+and+Initial+Configuration
How do you like that style?

item.title: Do you like these table style instructions?
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
if you are asking on just opinions then i didnt like that since some of the sites were using it. but maybe others will say well this is the modern style ? i dunno , but for me its really eyes hurting and brain loosing.

Read full topic
item.source: Do you like these table style instructions?

item.title: Do you like these table style instructions?
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
The first thing that stands out is the warnings and important info (red text) is integrated with the instructions. Not heeding the warnings or not reading the warnings has always been an issue for users. My eyes went right to the red text.

Overall these tables look simpler and better organized. The different colors used, for example, (“Examples Output” ) are in black block text. Makes it very easy to read IMO.

Read full topic
item.source: Do you like these table style instructions?
